title: Rewrite all chapters in refs/simple in MoonBit
description: Implementation rule: keep the MoonBit rewrite as close as possible to the reference implementation in refs/simple (structure, naming, behavior).\n\nThis rule must be inherited by all subtasks derived from simple.mbt-0ia.
notes: Keep implementation as close as possible to refs/simple; this rule applies to all subtasks derived from #simple.mbt-0ia.

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Closed out remaining chapter ports (20-24) and regenerated pkg.generated.mbti; moon test passes across module.

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Reminder: keep MoonBit rewrite as close as possible to refs/simple (structure, naming, behavior); inherit for all subtasks derived from simple.mbt-0ia.

title: Chapter 01: MoonBit port
description:
Port `refs/simple/chapter01` to MoonBit.

Implementation rule (inherited from `simple.mbt-0ia`): keep the MoonBit rewrite as close as possible to the reference implementation in `refs/simple` (structure, naming, behavior).
acceptance_criteria:
- `moon test` passes for `chapter01`.
- Parser + node graph behavior matches `refs/simple/chapter01` tests and error messages.

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Started chapter19 backend port: added CodeGen driver scaffolding (parse/opto/type_check placeholders) and an initial Eval2 wrapper (currently delegates to Evaluator; full call/closure support and inst_select/local_sched still TODO to match refs/simple).

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Implemented x86_64_v2 instSelect for float ops (addf/subf/mulf/divf) + i2f8, LEA pattern matching, and power-of-two mul->shli; expanded Chapter19 tests (basic12-20, if stmt, lea1-3) and updated Chapter12 float-string expectations for chapter19 snapshot. Verified: moon test passes.

title: Chapter10: eliminate reserved keyword warnings
description: MoonBit emits reserved_keyword warnings in chapter10 (e.g. identifiers 'alias', 'use', 'define', 'upcast'). Rename internal locals/params/methods to non-reserved spellings while keeping behavior/printing consistent with refs/simple.
acceptance_criteria: -  emits no reserved_keyword warnings.\n- Total tests: 145, passed: 145, failed: 0. still passes.

title: Chapter 16: eliminate reserved keyword warnings
description: Rename reserved identifier usages (e.g., alias) in chapter16 Type/Field code to eliminate reserved_keyword warnings while keeping behavior identical to refs/simple.
acceptance_criteria:
- `moon test` passes
- `moon test chapter16` shows no reserved_keyword warnings from chapter16/type.mbt

title: Backend parity: ListScheduler/local_sched + RegAlloc phases (refs/simple chapter20+)
description: Implement local scheduling and (at least initial) register allocation phases in CodeGen to better match refs/simple/chapter20+ (CodeGen.local_sched and RegAlloc currently placeholders).\n\nImplementation rule: keep as close as possible to refs/simple (structure, naming, behavior).
acceptance_criteria:
- Implement ListScheduler/local_sched equivalent and wire into CodeGen.local_sched.
- Implement initial RegAlloc phase plumbing or a minimal allocator compatible with current Mach graph.
- Add tests validating deterministic scheduling/regalloc behavior (snapshot IR where appropriate).
- moon test passes.

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Implemented ListScheduler/local_sched and minimal RegAlloc across chapter20-24 (new list_scheduler/reg_alloc files, local_scheduled flag, reg_alloc/reg_alloc_dump). Added chapter20 regalloc_test and updated evaluator scheduling to respect local_sched. Ran: moon test chapter20/regalloc_test.mbt, moon test chapter20/chapter20_test.mbt, moon info --package chapter20-24.

title: Regenerate pkg.generated.mbti for all chapter packages
description:
Many chapter directories have stale `pkg.generated.mbti` headers (e.g. reporting the wrong package path like `.../chapter08`).

Run `moon info` to regenerate `pkg.generated.mbti` files so package names and exported APIs reflect the current source tree.
acceptance_criteria:
- Running `moon info` updates `pkg.generated.mbti` files consistently
- `moon test` passes

title: Eliminate reserved_keyword alias warnings (chapter15, chapter18-24)
description:
MoonBit emits reserved_keyword warnings for identifier "alias" in Type/Field code (seen in `moon check` for chapter15 and chapter18+).

Rename locals/params using "alias" to non-reserved spellings (e.g. "alias_") while keeping behavior/printing identical and staying as close as possible to refs/simple.
acceptance_criteria:
- moon check chapter15 shows no reserved_keyword warnings for "alias"
- moon check chapter18..chapter24 show no reserved_keyword warnings for "alias"
- moon test passes

title: Eliminate reserved_keyword define warnings (chapter03-09)
description:
MoonBit emits reserved_keyword warnings for method name "define" (e.g. Node::define) in early chapters.

Rename Node::define to Node::define_ (and update call sites) while keeping behavior/printing identical and staying as close as possible to refs/simple.
acceptance_criteria:
- moon check chapter03..chapter09 show no reserved_keyword warnings for "define"
- moon test passes

title: Investigate full moon test timeout
description: Full moon test timed out after 240s in this environment; rerun or profile to ensure suite passes.

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Ran 'moon test -v --no-parallelize' (120s timeout); sequential moonrun commands progressed through chapter suites before timeout. Likely full suite just >240s here; suggest higher timeout or per-package runs.

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Full 'moon test' still times out after 600s in this environment (no completion). Likely suite >10min here; recommend higher timeout or per-package runs.

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Notes: 'moon test --dry-run -v' shows it builds/runs internal+blackbox tests (incl doctest-only) for every chapter package. Each chapter dir contains cumulative *_test.mbt files (279 total across chapter01-24). Running only the latest package is fast: 'time moon test --package chapter24' ran 215 tests in ~0.1s here. Suggest CI/dev to run per-package (e.g., chapter24) vs full suite.

title: Backend parity: function literals/calls/closures + Eval2 (refs/simple chapter19+)
description: Implement missing function literal/call/closure support to match refs/simple semantics (currently parser lacks {..->..} and call nodes; Eval2 is placeholder delegating to Evaluator).\n\nImplementation rule: keep as close as possible to refs/simple (structure, naming, behavior).
acceptance_criteria: - Can parse and evaluate representative refs/simple chapter19+ programs using lambdas/closures (e.g., String/hashCode example) with matching output.\n- Add MoonBit tests covering function literals/calls/closures in chapter19+ packages.\n- moon test passes.

comments.author: Wen Yuxiang
comments.text: Implemented chapter19 function literal/call/closure parity and fixed opto/inlining/mem/if handling to match refs/simple. Chapter19 tests pass. Full moon test timed out after 240s in this environment.
